Class SmtpServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • SmtpServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

     class SmtpServer
extends java.lang.Thread
    The SmtpServer Class is designed to listen for an incoming Smtp request, and spawn an SmtpRequestHandler object to manage the remote request.
    Version:
    1.0a Date: 6/28/2008
    Author:
    Ken Molcsan Jr.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Purpose: The run() method is the method that will be called by the Thread start() method after the thread has been instantiated. For this server thread, run will call the listener.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
        See Also:
        SmtpServer.listen()

      • listen

        public void listen()
        Purpose: The listen() method initializes the server socket listener and waits for an incoming connection. When a connection is received, an SmtpRequestHandler thread will be triggered, and the listener will continue to listen for incoming requests.
        See Also:
        SmtpRequestHandler
